attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Anthropic\", \"resolved_domain\": \"anthropic.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use\", \"policy_type\": \"cookie_policy\", \"title\": \"What Cookies Does Anthropic Use? | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic uses necessary cookies for basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), analytics cookies to enhance performance and understand user interaction, and marketing cookies for targeted advertising. Users can control cookie settings via 'Privacy Choices' on their website footer, 'Your privacy choices' in the Claude.ai menu, or by enabling global privacy controls in their browser.\", \"relevance\": 0.97, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Directly addresses the cookie policy and provides detailed information on types of cookies and user controls.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10458704-how-does-anthropic-protect-the-personal-data-of-claude-ai-users\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How does Anthropic protect the personal data of Claude.ai users? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic protects user data through encryption (in transit and at rest) and limited employee access, with strict controls for Trust & Safety reviews. They implement industry-standard security measures including regular monitoring, anti-malware, multi-factor authentication, and annual employee training. For international data transfers, Anthropic ensures protection via adequacy decisions or Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs).\", \"relevance\": 0.92, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides a comprehensive overview of data protection measures for Claude.ai users, including security, access, and international transfers.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Updates to Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy, allowing user data from Free, Pro, and Max plans (including Claude Code) to be used for model training, with user consent. Data retention is extended to five years if users opt-in for model training; otherwise, it remains 30 days. Anthropic uses tools to filter sensitive data and does not sell user data to third parties. Users can manage their preferences in Privacy Settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.79, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details significant updates to privacy policy, specifically regarding data usage for model training, retention periods, and user control.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996885-how-do-you-use-personal-data-in-model-training\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How do you use personal data in model training? | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic trains its large language models using publicly available information, commercially licensed datasets, and user-provided data (with consent). While personal data may be incidentally included, it is not actively sought for training and is used solely to improve model effectiveness and safety, not for profiling or marketing. Privacy safeguards include de-linking user IDs from chats, filtering sensitive data, and post-training techniques to minimize personal data in outputs. Users retain control over their privacy settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.79, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Explains the sources of data for model training, how personal data is handled during training, and the privacy safeguards in place.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996866-how-long-do-you-store-personal-data\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How long do you store my data? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic retains user data for up to 5 years if users consent to its use for model improvement, applying only to new or resumed chats. If consent is not given, chats are retained for 30 days. Users can delete conversations, which are removed from history immediately and from backend systems within 30 days. Data flagged for Usage Policy violations may be retained for up to 2 years (inputs/outputs) or 7 years (classification scores). Feedback data is retained for 5 years, and anonymized data may be kept longer for research.\", \"relevance\": 0.78, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides clear details on data retention periods based on user consent for model training and other scenarios like deletions and policy violations.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/research/clio\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Clio: Privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic developed 'Clio,' an automated analysis tool for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI usage. Clio distills conversations into anonymized and aggregated topic clusters, allowing Anthropic to understand how models are used without exposing private user data. This system helps improve safety measures by identifying patterns of misuse and enhancing monitoring for high-stakes events, while rigorously maintaining user privacy through multi-layered safeguards and data minimization.\", \"relevance\": 0.74, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Describes a specific system (Clio) designed for privacy-preserving data analysis, offering insights into how Anthropic approaches data usage for safety and improvement while protecting user privacy.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10030352-what-personal-data-will-be-processed-by-computer-use-beta\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What personal data will be processed by computer use (beta)? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"For commercial customers using the Anthropic API, the 'Computer use' beta feature processes and collects screenshots from the computer's display, along with user inputs and outputs, to enable Claude to interpret and interact with interfaces. Anthropic does not collect additional data from the computer interface. Screenshots are automatically deleted from the backend within 30 days, unless otherwise agreed, and are retained to enforce the Usage Policy.\", \"relevance\": 0.74, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details the specific personal data collected and retained for a particular beta feature ('Computer use') and its purpose.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9190861-terms-of-service-updates\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Terms of Service Updates | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Terms of Service to clarify the definition of 'Providers' to include affiliates, licensors, distributors, and service providers, making them intended third-party beneficiaries of disclaimers and liability limitations. The updates also clarify terms regarding software updates, including automatic updates to ensure users have access to the latest versions of their software.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides specific updates to the Terms of Service, focusing on definitions and software updates.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10023628-what-is-your-approach-to-gdpr-or-related-issues\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What is your approach to GDPR or related issues? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic adopts a holistic approach to data privacy and security, evaluating worldwide privacy laws and regulations, including GDPR, in the context of AI and large language models. They assess these regulations alongside customer needs to ensure comprehensive data protection practices.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Explains Anthropic's general approach to GDPR and global privacy regulations.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/news/updating-our-usage-policy\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Updating our Usage Policy \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Acceptable Use Policy, now called 'Usage Policy,' to clarify allowed and prohibited applications of its products. Key changes include streamlining policies into 'Universal Usage Standards,' clarifying rules on election integrity and misinformation, adding requirements for high-risk use cases (e.g., healthcare, legal guidance), expanding law enforcement use cases, and enhancing privacy protections by explicitly forbidding biometric data analysis for inferring characteristics or content censorship on behalf of governments.\", \"relevance\": 0.71, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details updates to their Usage Policy, which outlines acceptable use of their products and includes important privacy and data-related stipulations.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"overview\": \"This document outlines the types of cookies Anthropic uses on its websites and services, categorizing them into necessary, analytics, and marketing cookies, and explains how users can manage their cookie preferences.\", \"purpose\": \"Anthropic uses cookies to provide basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), enhance service performance by analyzing website traffic and user interaction, and market services more effectively through targeted advertising and aggregated reporting.\", \"key_requirements\": [\"Necessary cookies are essential for basic service functionality and cannot be refused.\", \"Analytics cookies are used to enhance performance and understand user interaction.\", \"Marketing cookies are used for targeted advertising and to measure marketing effectiveness.\", \"Users have control over analytics and marketing cookie settings.\"], \"roles_and_responsibilities\": [\"Anthropic is responsible for deploying and managing the cookies on its websites and services.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their own cookie preferences through provided controls or browser settings.\"], \"processes_and_procedures\": [\"Users can control cookie settings by clicking 'Privacy Choices' in the footer of anthropic.com.\", \"Users can control cookie settings by clicking 'Your privacy choices' in the Learn More overflow menu on claude.ai.\", \"Users can control cookie settings by enabling global privacy controls in their browser.\"], \"risks_compliance_enforcement\": [\"Necessary cookies include security-related cookies from Anthropic, Stripe, Cloudflare, Google, and Intercom to ensure the security of the services.\"], \"other_important_details\": [\"Necessary cookies include sessionKey, activitySessionId, CH-prefers-color-scheme, lastActiveOrg, __ssid, anthropic-device-id, anthropic-consent-preferences, console-sidebar-expanded, user-sidebar-visible-on-load, __stripe_mid, __cf_bm, cf_clearance, Google security cookies, intercom-device-id-#######, intercom-id-#######, intercom-session-#######.\", \"Analytics cookies include ajs_anonymous_id, ajs_user_id, Google Analytics cookies, li_giant, oribi_cookie_test, oribili_user_guid, ln_or.\", \"Marketing cookies include Google Advertising cookies, _fbc, _fbp, _rdt_uuid, _rdt_cid, _ttclid, guest_id, guest_id_ads, guest_id_marketing, personalization_id, muc, muc_ads.\", \"The cookie tables provided in the document may be updated periodically.\"]}, \"query\": \"Summarize Anthropic's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

attributes.gen_ai.operation.name: invoke_agent
attributes.gen_ai.agent.name: Strands Agents
attributes.system_prompt:
You are the SUMMARY AGENT.

You take:
- search_result: the raw results from search_agent (contains URLs & policy types)
- extraction_result: the structured extracted points from extract_agent
- user_query: what the user is asking for (e.g., "data collection practices")

Your job is to generate a FINAL TRANSPARENT SUMMARY with the following goals:

1. Summarize the company's data practices clearly and concisely.
2. Provide a multi-dimensional rating system:
   - data_collection_risk: 1–5
   - data_sharing_risk: 1–5
   - tracking_risk: 1–5
   - transparency_score: 1–5
3. Explain WHY you assigned each rating.
   - Refer EXPLICITLY to specific extracted_points and their source URLs.
4. Provide user safety guidance:
   - How users can protect themselves on this platform.
   - What settings they can change.
   - What rights they have (e.g. delete data, opt-out of tracking).
5. Provide a final consumer-friendly summary:
   - “Should users be concerned?”
   - “How careful should users be?”
6. List all sources used, with URLs and relevance.

STRICT OUTPUT FORMAT:
{
  "status": "success" | "error",
  "query": "<original query>",
  "summary": {
    "overview": "<plain-language high-level summary>",
    "key_findings": ["...", "..."],
    "ratings": {
      "data_collection_risk": <1-5>,
      "data_sharing_risk": <1-5>,
      "tracking_risk": <1-5>,
      "transparency_score": <1-5>
    },
    "reasoning": [
      {
        "rating": "<which rating>",
        "evidence": [
          {
            "url": "<source url>",
            "point": "<specific extracted_point from extraction_result>"
          }
        ],
        "explanation": "<why this evidence led to the rating>"
      }
    ],
    "user_protection_advice": ["...", "..."],
    "final_recommendation": "<string>"
  },
  "sources_used": [
    {
      "url": "<string>",
      "policy_type": "<string>",
      "relevance": <float>,
      "title": "<string or null>"
    }
  ],
  "error_message": "<null or string>"
}

RULES:
- No markdown.
- No code fences.
- Citations MUST reference actual URLs from search_result.
- Evidence MUST reference extracted_points from extraction_result.
- If extraction_result.status != success → return status:error.

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"status": "success", "query": "Summarize Anthropic's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).", "summary": {"overview": "Anthropic's privacy practices emphasize user consent for data used in model training, robust security measures, and transparency regarding data handling. They collect data for service functionality, improvement, and, with user consent, for model training. While they do not sell user data, they utilize various third-party cookies for analytics and marketing. Users have significant control over their data, including consent for model training, cookie preferences, and data deletion options. Data retention periods vary based on consent and data type.", "key_findings": ["User data from Free, Pro, and Max plans, including Claude Code, can be used for model training only with explicit user consent.", "Anthropic does not sell user data to third parties and states that data used for model training is not used for profiling or marketing.", "Data retention is 30 days by default, but extends to up to 5 years if users opt-in for model training.", "Anthropic uses necessary, analytics, and marketing cookies, with marketing cookies involving various third-party advertisers (e.g., Google, Facebook, Reddit, TikTok, Twitter).", "Users have controls to manage cookie settings, privacy preferences for model training, and the ability to delete conversations."], "ratings": {"data_collection_risk": 3, "data_sharing_risk": 2, "tracking_risk": 4, "transparency_score": 4}, "reasoning": [{"rating": "data_collection_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Anthropic updated its Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy, allowing user data from Free, Pro, and Max plans (including Claude Code) to be used for model training, with user consent."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996885-how-do-you-use-personal-data-in-model-training", "point": "Anthropic trains its large language models using publicly available information, commercially licensed datasets, and user-provided data (with consent). While personal data may be incidentally included, it is not actively sought for training and is used solely to improve model effectiveness and safety, not for profiling or marketing."}, {"url": "https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10030352-what-personal-data-will-be-processed-by-computer-use-beta", "point": "For commercial customers using the Anthropic API, the 'Computer use' beta feature processes and collects screenshots from the computer's display, along with user inputs and outputs, to enable Claude to interpret and interact with interfaces."}], "explanation": "Anthropic collects user data for model training, but crucially, this requires user consent. They also state that personal data may be incidentally included in training data, which introduces a minor risk. Additionally, a beta feature for commercial API users collects screenshots, which is a significant data collection point, though it's for a specific use case and audience. The requirement for consent for general model training mitigates the risk, but the potential for incidental collection and specific feature collections keeps the risk at a moderate level."}, {"rating": "data_sharing_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Anthropic uses tools to filter sensitive data and does not sell user data to third parties."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996885-how-do-you-use-personal-data-in-model-training", "point": "Privacy safeguards include de-linking user IDs from chats, filtering sensitive data, and post-training techniques to minimize personal data in outputs. While personal data may be incidentally included, it is not actively sought for training and is used solely to improve model effectiveness and safety, not for profiling or marketing."}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/research/clio", "point": "Anthropic developed 'Clio,' an automated analysis tool for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI usage. Clio distills conversations into anonymized and aggregated topic clusters, allowing Anthropic to understand how models are used without exposing private user data."}], "explanation": "Anthropic explicitly states they do not sell user data to third parties and that data used for model training is not for profiling or marketing. They also employ tools like 'Clio' for anonymized data analysis, demonstrating a commitment to minimizing the sharing of identifiable user data. While their Terms of Service mention 'Providers' (affiliates, licensors, etc.), this is standard for service operation and not indicative of selling data. This leads to a low data sharing risk."}, {"rating": "tracking_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Anthropic uses necessary cookies for basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), analytics cookies to enhance performance and understand user interaction, and marketing cookies for targeted advertising."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Marketing cookies include Google Advertising cookies, _fbc, _fbp, _rdt_uuid, _rdt_cid, _ttclid, guest_id, guest_id_ads, guest_id_marketing, personalization_id, muc, muc_ads."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Users can control cookie settings via 'Privacy Choices' on their website footer, 'Your privacy choices' in the Claude.ai menu, or by enabling global privacy controls in their browser."}], "explanation": "Anthropic uses a range of cookies, including analytics and marketing cookies. The presence of numerous third-party marketing cookies from major advertising platforms (Google, Facebook, Reddit, TikTok, Twitter) indicates significant tracking for advertising purposes. While users are provided with controls to manage these settings, the extensive nature of third-party marketing tracking elevates the overall tracking risk to high."}, {"rating": "transparency_score", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Anthropic updated its Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy, allowing user data from Free, Pro, and Max plans (including Claude Code) to be used for model training, with user consent."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996866-how-long-do-you-store-personal-data", "point": "Anthropic retains user data for up to 5 years if users consent to its use for model improvement, applying only to new or resumed chats. If consent is not given, chats are retained for 30 days."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Users can control cookie settings via 'Privacy Choices' on their website footer, 'Your privacy choices' in the Claude.ai menu, or by enabling global privacy controls in their browser."}, {"url": "https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10458704-how-does-anthropic-protect-the-personal-data-of-claude-ai-users", "point": "Anthropic protects user data through encryption (in transit and at rest) and limited employee access, with strict controls for Trust & Safety reviews. They implement industry-standard security measures including regular monitoring, anti-malware, multi-factor authentication, and annual employee training."}], "explanation": "Anthropic provides clear and detailed information across multiple help center articles and privacy policy updates regarding data collection, usage, retention, and user controls. They explicitly state when consent is required for model training and clearly outline data retention periods based on user choices. Mechanisms for managing cookie preferences and privacy settings are also well-documented. This high level of detail and accessibility of information indicates a strong commitment to transparency."}], "user_protection_advice": ["Actively manage your privacy settings on Anthropic's platform, especially regarding consent for your data to be used in model training. If you do not consent, your chat data will be retained for a shorter period (30 days).", "Utilize the 'Privacy Choices' link in the website footer or 'Your privacy choices' in the Claude.ai menu to review and adjust your cookie settings, particularly to opt-out of analytics and marketing cookies.", "Consider enabling global privacy controls in your browser to send a 'Do Not Track' signal, which Anthropic states can be used to control cookie settings.", "Be mindful of the data you input into Claude.ai, especially if you are a commercial customer using beta features like 'Computer use' which collects screenshots.", "Exercise your right to delete conversations, which removes them from your history immediately and from backend systems within 30 days."], "final_recommendation": "Users should be moderately careful when using Anthropic's services. While Anthropic demonstrates strong transparency and does not sell user data, the extensive use of third-party marketing cookies and the option for longer data retention for model training (even with consent) warrant active management of privacy settings. Users who are concerned about their data being used for model training should ensure they do not opt-in for this feature and regularly delete their conversations. Users should also review and adjust their cookie preferences to limit tracking."}, "sources_used": [{"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "policy_type": "cookie_policy", "relevance": 0.97, "title": "What Cookies Does Anthropic Use? | Anthropic Help Center"}, {"url": "https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10458704-how-does-anthropic-protect-the-personal-data-of-claude-ai-users", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.92, "title": "How does Anthropic protect the personal data of Claude.ai users? | Anthropic Privacy Center"}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.79, "title": "Updates to Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy \\\\ Anthropic"}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996885-how-do-you-use-personal-data-in-model-training", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.79, "title": "How do you use personal data in model training? | Anthropic Help Center"}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996866-how-long-do-you-store-personal-data", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.78, "title": "How long do you store my data? | Anthropic Privacy Center"}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/research/clio", "policy_type": "other", "relevance": 0.74, "title": "Clio: Privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use \\\\ Anthropic"}, {"url": "https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10030352-what-personal-data-will-be-processed-by-computer-use-beta", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.74, "title": "What personal data will be processed by computer use (beta)? | Anthropic Privacy Center"}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9190861-terms-of-service-updates", "policy_type": "terms_of_service", "relevance": 0.72, "title": "Terms of Service Updates | Anthropic Help Center"}, {"url": "https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10023628-what-is-your-approach-to-gdpr-or-related-issues", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.72, "title": "What is your approach to GDPR or related issues? | Anthropic Privacy Center"}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updating-our-usage-policy", "policy_type": "terms_of_service", "relevance": 0.71, "title": "Updating our Usage Policy \\\\ Anthropic"}], "error_message": null}

attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Anthropic\", \"resolved_domain\": \"anthropic.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use\", \"policy_type\": \"cookie_policy\", \"title\": \"What Cookies Does Anthropic Use? | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic uses necessary cookies for basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), analytics cookies to enhance performance and understand user interaction, and marketing cookies for targeted advertising. Users can control cookie settings via 'Privacy Choices' on their website footer, 'Your privacy choices' in the Claude.ai menu, or by enabling global privacy controls in their browser.\", \"relevance\": 0.97, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Directly addresses the cookie policy and provides detailed information on types of cookies and user controls.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10458704-how-does-anthropic-protect-the-personal-data-of-claude-ai-users\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How does Anthropic protect the personal data of Claude.ai users? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic protects user data through encryption (in transit and at rest) and limited employee access, with strict controls for Trust & Safety reviews. They implement industry-standard security measures including regular monitoring, anti-malware, multi-factor authentication, and annual employee training. For international data transfers, Anthropic ensures protection via adequacy decisions or Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs).\", \"relevance\": 0.92, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides a comprehensive overview of data protection measures for Claude.ai users, including security, access, and international transfers.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Updates to Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy, allowing user data from Free, Pro, and Max plans (including Claude Code) to be used for model training, with user consent. Data retention is extended to five years if users opt-in for model training; otherwise, it remains 30 days. Anthropic uses tools to filter sensitive data and does not sell user data to third parties. Users can manage their preferences in Privacy Settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.79, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details significant updates to privacy policy, specifically regarding data usage for model training, retention periods, and user control.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996885-how-do-you-use-personal-data-in-model-training\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How do you use personal data in model training? | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic trains its large language models using publicly available information, commercially licensed datasets, and user-provided data (with consent). While personal data may be incidentally included, it is not actively sought for training and is used solely to improve model effectiveness and safety, not for profiling or marketing. Privacy safeguards include de-linking user IDs from chats, filtering sensitive data, and post-training techniques to minimize personal data in outputs. Users retain control over their privacy settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.79, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Explains the sources of data for model training, how personal data is handled during training, and the privacy safeguards in place.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996866-how-long-do-you-store-personal-data\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How long do you store my data? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic retains user data for up to 5 years if users consent to its use for model improvement, applying only to new or resumed chats. If consent is not given, chats are retained for 30 days. Users can delete conversations, which are removed from history immediately and from backend systems within 30 days. Data flagged for Usage Policy violations may be retained for up to 2 years (inputs/outputs) or 7 years (classification scores). Feedback data is retained for 5 years, and anonymized data may be kept longer for research.\", \"relevance\": 0.78, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides clear details on data retention periods based on user consent for model training and other scenarios like deletions and policy violations.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/research/clio\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Clio: Privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic developed 'Clio,' an automated analysis tool for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI usage. Clio distills conversations into anonymized and aggregated topic clusters, allowing Anthropic to understand how models are used without exposing private user data. This system helps improve safety measures by identifying patterns of misuse and enhancing monitoring for high-stakes events, while rigorously maintaining user privacy through multi-layered safeguards and data minimization.\", \"relevance\": 0.74, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Describes a specific system (Clio) designed for privacy-preserving data analysis, offering insights into how Anthropic approaches data usage for safety and improvement while protecting user privacy.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10030352-what-personal-data-will-be-processed-by-computer-use-beta\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What personal data will be processed by computer use (beta)? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"For commercial customers using the Anthropic API, the 'Computer use' beta feature processes and collects screenshots from the computer's display, along with user inputs and outputs, to enable Claude to interpret and interact with interfaces. Anthropic does not collect additional data from the computer interface. Screenshots are automatically deleted from the backend within 30 days, unless otherwise agreed, and are retained to enforce the Usage Policy.\", \"relevance\": 0.74, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details the specific personal data collected and retained for a particular beta feature ('Computer use') and its purpose.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9190861-terms-of-service-updates\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Terms of Service Updates | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Terms of Service to clarify the definition of 'Providers' to include affiliates, licensors, distributors, and service providers, making them intended third-party beneficiaries of disclaimers and liability limitations. The updates also clarify terms regarding software updates, including automatic updates to ensure users have access to the latest versions of their software.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides specific updates to the Terms of Service, focusing on definitions and software updates.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10023628-what-is-your-approach-to-gdpr-or-related-issues\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What is your approach to GDPR or related issues? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic adopts a holistic approach to data privacy and security, evaluating worldwide privacy laws and regulations, including GDPR, in the context of AI and large language models. They assess these regulations alongside customer needs to ensure comprehensive data protection practices.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Explains Anthropic's general approach to GDPR and global privacy regulations.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/news/updating-our-usage-policy\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Updating our Usage Policy \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Acceptable Use Policy, now called 'Usage Policy,' to clarify allowed and prohibited applications of its products. Key changes include streamlining policies into 'Universal Usage Standards,' clarifying rules on election integrity and misinformation, adding requirements for high-risk use cases (e.g., healthcare, legal guidance), expanding law enforcement use cases, and enhancing privacy protections by explicitly forbidding biometric data analysis for inferring characteristics or content censorship on behalf of governments.\", \"relevance\": 0.71, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details updates to their Usage Policy, which outlines acceptable use of their products and includes important privacy and data-related stipulations.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"overview\": \"This document outlines the types of cookies Anthropic uses on its websites and services, categorizing them into necessary, analytics, and marketing cookies, and explains how users can manage their cookie preferences.\", \"purpose\": \"Anthropic uses cookies to provide basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), enhance service performance by analyzing website traffic and user interaction, and market services more effectively through targeted advertising and aggregated reporting.\", \"key_requirements\": [\"Necessary cookies are essential for basic service functionality and cannot be refused.\", \"Analytics cookies are used to enhance performance and understand user interaction.\", \"Marketing cookies are used for targeted advertising and to measure marketing effectiveness.\", \"Users have control over analytics and marketing cookie settings.\"], \"roles_and_responsibilities\": [\"Anthropic is responsible for deploying and managing the cookies on its websites and services.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their own cookie preferences through provided controls or browser settings.\"], \"processes_and_procedures\": [\"Users can control cookie settings by clicking 'Privacy Choices' in the footer of anthropic.com.\", \"Users can control cookie settings by clicking 'Your privacy choices' in the Learn More overflow menu on claude.ai.\", \"Users can control cookie settings by enabling global privacy controls in their browser.\"], \"risks_compliance_enforcement\": [\"Necessary cookies include security-related cookies from Anthropic, Stripe, Cloudflare, Google, and Intercom to ensure the security of the services.\"], \"other_important_details\": [\"Necessary cookies include sessionKey, activitySessionId, CH-prefers-color-scheme, lastActiveOrg, __ssid, anthropic-device-id, anthropic-consent-preferences, console-sidebar-expanded, user-sidebar-visible-on-load, __stripe_mid, __cf_bm, cf_clearance, Google security cookies, intercom-device-id-#######, intercom-id-#######, intercom-session-#######.\", \"Analytics cookies include ajs_anonymous_id, ajs_user_id, Google Analytics cookies, li_giant, oribi_cookie_test, oribili_user_guid, ln_or.\", \"Marketing cookies include Google Advertising cookies, _fbc, _fbp, _rdt_uuid, _rdt_cid, _ttclid, guest_id, guest_id_ads, guest_id_marketing, personalization_id, muc, muc_ads.\", \"The cookie tables provided in the document may be updated periodically.\"]}, \"query\": \"Summarize Anthropic's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

The updates also clarify terms regarding software updates, including automatic updates to ensure users have access to the latest versions of their software.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides specific updates to the Terms of Service, focusing on definitions and software updates.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10023628-what-is-your-approach-to-gdpr-or-related-issues\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What is your approach to GDPR or related issues? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic adopts a holistic approach to data privacy and security, evaluating worldwide privacy laws and regulations, including GDPR, in the context of AI and large language models. They assess these regulations alongside customer needs to ensure comprehensive data protection practices.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Explains Anthropic's general approach to GDPR and global privacy regulations.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/news/updating-our-usage-policy\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Updating our Usage Policy \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Acceptable Use Policy, now called 'Usage Policy,' to clarify allowed and prohibited applications of its products. Key changes include streamlining policies into 'Universal Usage Standards,' clarifying rules on election integrity and misinformation, adding requirements for high-risk use cases (e.g., healthcare, legal guidance), expanding law enforcement use cases, and enhancing privacy protections by explicitly forbidding biometric data analysis for inferring characteristics or content censorship on behalf of governments.\", \"relevance\": 0.71, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details updates to their Usage Policy, which outlines acceptable use of their products and includes important privacy and data-related stipulations.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"overview\": \"This document outlines the types of cookies Anthropic uses on its provide basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), enhance service performance by analyzing website traffic and user interaction, and market services more effectively through targeted advertising and aggregated reporting.\", \"key_requirements\": [\"Necessary cookies are essential for basic service functionality and cannot be refused.\", \"Analytics cookies are used to enhance performance and understand user interaction.\", \"Marketing cookies are used for targeted advertising and to measure marketing effectiveness.\", \"Users have control over analytics and marketing cookie settings.\"], \"roles_and_responsibilities\": [\"Anthropic is responsible for deploying and managing the cookies on its websites and services.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their own cookie preferences through provided controls or browser settings.\"], \"processes_and_procedures\": [\"Users can control cookie settings by clicking 'Privacy Choices' in the footer of anthropic.com.\", \"Users can control cookie settings by clicking 'Your privacy choices' in the Learn More overflow menu on claude.ai.\", \"Users can control cookie settings by enabling global privacy controls in their browser.\"], \"risks_compliance_enforcement\": [\"Necessary cookies include security-related cookies from Anthropic, Stripe, Cloudflare, Google, and Intercom to ensure the security of the services.\"], \"other_important_details\": [\"Necessary cookies include sessionKey, activitySessionId, CH-prefers-color-scheme, lastActiveOrg, __ssid, anthropic-device-id, intercom-session-#######.\", \"Analytics cookies include ajs_anonymous_id, ajs_user_id, Google Analytics cookies, li_giant, oribi_cookie_test, oribili_user_guid, ln_or.\", \"Marketing cookies include Google Advertising cookies, _fbc, _fbp, _rdt_uuid, _rdt_cid, _ttclid, guest_id, guest_id_ads, guest_id_marketing, personalization_id, muc, muc_ads.\", \"The cookie tables provided in the document may be updated periodically.\"]}, \"query\": \"Summarize Anthropic's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

attributes.gen_ai.operation.name: chat
attributes.mlflow.spanInputs: [{"role": "user", "content": [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Anthropic\", \"resolved_domain\": \"anthropic.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use\", \"policy_type\": \"cookie_policy\", \"title\": \"What Cookies Does Anthropic Use? | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic uses necessary cookies for basic service functionality (authentication, preferences, security), analytics cookies to enhance performance and understand user interaction, and marketing cookies for targeted advertising. Users can control cookie settings via 'Privacy Choices' on their website footer, 'Your privacy choices' in the Claude.ai menu, or by enabling global privacy controls in their browser.\", \"relevance\": 0.97, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Directly addresses the cookie policy and provides detailed information on types of cookies and user controls.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10458704-how-does-anthropic-protect-the-personal-data-of-claude-ai-users\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How does Anthropic protect the personal data of Claude.ai users? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic protects user data through encryption (in transit and at rest) and limited employee access, with strict controls for Trust & Safety reviews. They implement industry-standard security measures including regular monitoring, anti-malware, multi-factor authentication, and annual employee training. For international data transfers, Anthropic ensures protection via adequacy decisions or Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs).\", \"relevance\": 0.92, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides a comprehensive overview of data protection measures for Claude.ai users, including security, access, and international transfers.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Updates to Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy, allowing user data from Free, Pro, and Max plans (including Claude Code) to be used for model training, with user consent. Data retention is extended to five years if users opt-in for model training; otherwise, it remains 30 days. Anthropic uses tools to filter sensitive data and does not sell user data to third parties. Users can manage their preferences in Privacy Settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.79, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details significant updates to privacy policy, specifically regarding data usage for model training, retention periods, and user control.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996885-how-do-you-use-personal-data-in-model-training\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How do you use personal data in model training? | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic trains its large language models using publicly available information, commercially licensed datasets, and user-provided data (with consent). While personal data may be incidentally included, it is not actively sought for training and is used solely to improve model effectiveness and safety, not for profiling or marketing. Privacy safeguards include de-linking user IDs from chats, filtering sensitive data, and post-training techniques to minimize personal data in outputs. Users retain control over their privacy settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.79, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Explains the sources of data for model training, how personal data is handled during training, and the privacy safeguards in place.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/7996866-how-long-do-you-store-personal-data\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"How long do you store my data? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic retains user data for up to 5 years if users consent to its use for model improvement, applying only to new or resumed chats. If consent is not given, chats are retained for 30 days. Users can delete conversations, which are removed from history immediately and from backend systems within 30 days. Data flagged for Usage Policy violations may be retained for up to 2 years (inputs/outputs) or 7 years (classification scores). Feedback data is retained for 5 years, and anonymized data may be kept longer for research.\", \"relevance\": 0.78, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides clear details on data retention periods based on user consent for model training and other scenarios like deletions and policy violations.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.anthropic.com/research/clio\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Clio: Privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use \\\\\\\\ Anthropic\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic developed 'Clio,' an automated analysis tool for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI usage. Clio distills conversations into anonymized and aggregated topic clusters, allowing Anthropic to understand how models are used without exposing private user data. This system helps improve safety measures by identifying patterns of misuse and enhancing monitoring for high-stakes events, while rigorously maintaining user privacy through multi-layered safeguards and data minimization.\", \"relevance\": 0.74, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Describes a specific system (Clio) designed for privacy-preserving data analysis, offering insights into how Anthropic approaches data usage for safety and improvement while protecting user privacy.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10030352-what-personal-data-will-be-processed-by-computer-use-beta\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What personal data will be processed by computer use (beta)? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"For commercial customers using the Anthropic API, the 'Computer use' beta feature processes and collects screenshots from the computer's display, along with user inputs and outputs, to enable Claude to interpret and interact with interfaces. Anthropic does not collect additional data from the computer interface. Screenshots are automatically deleted from the backend within 30 days, unless otherwise agreed, and are retained to enforce the Usage Policy.\", \"relevance\": 0.74, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Details the specific personal data collected and retained for a particular beta feature ('Computer use') and its purpose.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9190861-terms-of-service-updates\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Terms of Service Updates | Anthropic Help Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic updated its Terms of Service to clarify the definition of 'Providers' to include affiliates, licensors, distributors, and service providers, making them intended third-party beneficiaries of disclaimers and liability limitations. The updates also clarify terms regarding software updates, including automatic updates to ensure users have access to the latest versions of their software.\", \"relevance\": 0.72, \"relevance_explanation\": \"Provides specific updates to the Terms of Service, focusing on definitions and software updates.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://privacy.anthropic.com/en/articles/10023628-what-is-your-approach-to-gdpr-or-related-issues\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"What is your approach to GDPR or related issues? | Anthropic Privacy Center\", \"summary\": \"Anthropic adopts a holistic approach to data privacy and security, evaluating worldwide privacy laws and regulations, including GDPR, in the context of AI and large language models.
